description: A tempting twist on the classic French canelé – a warm bite filled with the comforting flavours of melted cheese and savoury ham.
ingredients: [{"name": "unsalted butter", "units": "tablespoons", "amount": 6}, {"name": "beeswax pearls", "units": "tablespoons", "amount": 3}, {"name": "milk", "units": "ML", "amount": 400}, {"name": "vanilla bean", "units": "unit", "amount": 1}, {"name": "unsalted butter", "units": "tablespoons", "amount": 3}, {"name": "granulated sugar", "units": "g", "amount": 150}, {"name": "cake flour", "units": "g", "amount": 180}, {"name": "salt", "units": "teaspoon", "amount": 0.25}, {"name": "ground nutmeg", "units": "teaspoon", "amount": 0.25}, {"name": "egg yolks", "units": "units", "amount": 4}, {"name": "amber rum", "units": "tablespoon", "amount": 1}, {"name": "vanilla extract", "units": "teaspoon", "amount": 1}, {"name": "finely grated lemon zest", "units": "teaspoon", "amount": 0.25}, {"name": "Gruyère cheese", "units": "g", "amount": 100}, {"name": "diced ham", "units": "g", "amount": 100}, {"name": "black pepper", "units": "pinch", "amount": null}]
instructions: 1. Melt the butter in a small saucepan over low heat. Add the beeswax pearls (or honey) and stir until melted. Brush the inside of the cannelé moulds with the syrup. 2. Heat the milk in a small saucepan over medium heat until steaming. Add the vanilla bean and butter. 3. In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, salt, and nutmeg. In a separate bowl, whisk together the egg yolks, rum, vanilla extract, lemon zest, cheese, ham, and black pepper. Gradually add the milk mixture to the dry ingredients, whisking until smooth. Finally, add in the egg mixture and whisk until combined. 4. Cover the batter and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight. 5. Preheat the oven to 210°C (410°F). Fill the canelé moulds 2/3 of the way with batter. 6. Bake for 15 minutes at 210°C, then reduce to 180°C (350°F) and continue baking for another 45-55 minutes. 7. Let cool for a few minutes in the moulds before inverting onto a wire rack.
notes: Resting the batter overnight is essential for the best texture. Ensure your oven is fully preheated for a crisp caramelised crust. Cannelés can be frozen for up to two months.
